ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned all about the different theories that explain how Congress does its job (or doesnt)

Learned about congressional lawmaking, the underlying incentives of how legislators behave the way that they do, multiple theories of lawmaking, and Professor used many current events to demonstrate the concepts
Learned all about Congress and its mechanisms. Also learned a lot about what motivates congresspeople.
I now have a much greater understanding of the history, formal structure, impacts and theories of lawmaking in Congress.

I learned about the basis of Congress such as structure, information about how members of Congress behave, how parties are affected by Congress, and so much more. I learned a little bit of everything about Congress as the topics were interesting and organized well.
This was the first real political science class I took, I feel like I got a good grounding in the subject and in Congress specifically.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: great timeline for learning about the theories. Nice professor. Fun discussion
Weaknesses: wouldve liked more discussion and less lecturing, sometimes too much reading
Strengths: everything, Professor Dearborn is the best

This course was very well formatted. A seminar that starts of with a semi-lecture and then leads into very engaging conversation. Many props to Professor, as he always evened out the conversation between women students as guys, which is just something I always look for.
I like the format of lecture break and then discussion. The syllabus was very comprehensive and prof Dearborn is definitely really well versed! The readings were a bit long though but manageable

No weaknesses! The course was absolutely amazing and Professor Dearborn is an excellent professor! The course was organized well into a lecture and discussion format which was nice to review the material and discuss. The discussions were always interesting and the lectures were easy to follow!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The zoom format worked out pretty well for us as we were able to do breakout rooms
Structure of class made learning very effective and Professor Dearborn was very understanding about taking a break in the middle of the seminar
It was a fairly typical COVID Zoom seminar, we utilized screen share and the chat function.

Professor Dearborn did an excellent job of transitioning to zoom! The class was conducted entirely on zoom. I really enjoyed the breakout rooms before discussions because I was able to talk to students and discuss my thoughts before the main discussion. I really liked the format!
The virtual seminar worked well. I especially appreciated the short break we included in the middle  that was a very helpful time to regroup.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes!  Definitely take if youre interested at all in Congress or American politics!
Yes, this class not only taught you important aspects of Congress that are relevant today but Professor Dearborn was an amazing professor
Absolutely, the professor is good, the course workload makes sense, and it's a very engaging course on American Congress.

Yes, if you are a political science student with a focus on American gov this class is essential! If you want to learn more about the Us federal system as a non poli sci member i highly recommend it as well
Yes! I would recommend the course but Professor Dearborn is leaving Yale! The course was amazing! I knew what to expect with assignments and felt like I was putting what I learned into practice.
Yes, but not to one with a ton of previous knowledge about American politics.

Yes! So I actually didnt like this class but its because I figured out I didnt like political science. Professor Dearborn is so good at leading a discussion, even over zoom, and makes the material very accessible. I definitely felt like he was very engaged with us and interested in what we were thinking.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We also used breakout rooms in zoom
the class was conducted entirely over zoom!
None
